user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of parse_options:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
parse_options (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
               struct MHD_InterimParams_ *params,
               ...)
{
  va_list ap;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  va_start (ap, params);
  ret = parse_options_va (daemon,
                          params,
                          ap);
  va_end (ap);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  ret = parse_options_va (daemon,
                          params,
                          ap);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: parse_options calls parse_options_va (a different function), so there is no direct self-call. This snippet only violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 if parse_options_va (directly or indirectly) calls parse_options back (i.e. mutual/indirect recursion).
